description: Emergency gathering of free zone technologists and leaders as unexplained BCI malfunctions disrupt daily operations. Fears of sabotage and urgent calls for transparency dominate the discussion.
Oksana Lintz, disturbed by mounting unrest and recalling advice on moral courage, decides to authorize a full, uncensored release of BCI records and internal communications to free zone networks.
As data spreads, residents confront shocking details of BCI abuses and targeting under Halden’s regime. Protests erupt in several zones; suspicion mounts against the Directorate for likely sabotage.

Evidence confirms Directorate loyalists attempted to cripple reconciliation efforts via BCI sabotage. Emergency citizen forums refocus on reclaiming local control, uniting free zones in calls for justice.
With Council authority in disarray, free zones take collective action—restoring shared control over local systems and publicly denouncing all Council factions for historic complicity in BCI abuses.
